parse.title: List of nicknames used by George W. Bush

text.*:
Former American President George W. Bush is widely known to use nicknames to refer to journalists, fellow politicians, and members of his White House staff.

Contents

  • 1 Family
  • 2 Foreign leaders
  • 3 Staff
  • 4 Politicians
  • 5 Journalists
  • 6 Others
  • 7 See also
  • 8 References
  • 9 External links

Family[edit]

Nickname Personal name Notes
Poppy George H.W. Bush[1] 41st President of the United States, George W. Bush's father
Old Man
Bushie Laura Bush[2] 43rd First Lady of the United States, George W. Bush's wife. Nickname is mutual.

Foreign leaders[edit]

Nickname Personal name Office
Dino Jean Chrétien[3] 20th Prime Minister of Canada
Pootie-Poot Vladimir Putin[4][5][6] President and former Prime Minister of Russia
Ostrich Legs
Bandar Bar Bandar bin Sultan[7] Former ambassador to the United States from Saudi Arabia
Landslide Tony Blair[8] Former Prime Minister of the United Kingdom
Man of Steel John Howard and Kevin Rudd[9] Former Prime Ministers of Australia
Shoes Silvio Berlusconi[10] 50th Prime Minister of Italy
Juni Junichiro Koizumi[11] 56th Prime Minister of Japan

Staff[edit]

Nickname Personal name Notes
Big Time Dick Cheney[5] 46th Vice President of the United States of America
Vice
Rummy Donald Rumsfeld[6] 21st Secretary of Defense
Izzy Israel Hernandez[12] Special Assistant. The latter nickname was given for his role as provider of breath mints to the President on the campaign trail.
Altoid Boy
Boy Genius Karl Rove[5][10] Senior Advisor to the President of the United States
Turd Blossom
The Architect
Condi Condoleezza Rice[5] Secretary of State
Guru
The World's Greatest Hero Colin Powell[13] Secretary of State
Big O Paul O'Neill[14][15] Secretary of the Treasury. "Big O" superseded the alternate term.
Pablo
Fredo Alberto Gonzales[5][16] Attorney General
Barty Dan Barlett[17] Deputy Chief of Staff
Bart
Danny Boy
Captain Dan
Dan the Man
Ari-Bob Ari Fleischer[18] White House Press Secretary
High Prophet Karen Hughes[19] Special Advisor, Director of Communications under Texas Governor George W. Bush
Hurricane Karen
The Blade Mitch Daniels[20] Office of Management and Budget Director
My Man Mitch
Big Country Joe Allbaugh[21] Federal Emergency Management Agency Director
Brownie Michael D. Brown[22] Federal Emergency Management Agency Director
Brother George George Tenet[6] CIA Director
Tree Man Unnamed Forest Service official[23]
La Margarita Margaret Spellings[24] Secretary of Education
Tangent Man Andrew Card[25] White House Chief of Staff
Tiny Richard Armitage[26] Deputy Secretary of State
Light Bulb Andrew D. Lundquist[27] National Energy Policy Development Group Executive Director
Bullets Ann Veneman[28] Secretary of Agriculture
M&M Mary Matalin[29] Assistant to Dick Cheney
Horny Jonathan Horn[30] White House Speechwriter
Scrote Ronny Jackson[31] Physician to the President

Politicians[edit]

Nickname Personal name Notes
Bama Barack Obama[32] 44th President of the United States
Rock
Boner John Boehner[33] Republican Majority Leader
Big Boy Chris Christie[34] United States Attorney for the District of New Jersey, later Governor of New Jersey
Conan the Republican Arnold Schwarzenegger[35] Governor of California
Jazzman John Conyers[36] Michigan United States Congressman
Pablo Paul Wellstone[37] Minnesota Senator
Pedro Peter King[8] New York Congressman
Hogan[38] John McCain[8] Arizona Senator
Big George George Miller[1] California Congressman
Freddy Boy Fred Upton[1] Michigan Congressman
Freddo
Congressman Kickass John Sweeney[39] New York Congressman
Nellie[40] Ben Nelson[41] Nebraska Senator. "Nellie" was superseded by its alternative.
Benny[40]
Benator
Ellis Charles Ellis "Chuck" Schumer[42] New York Senator
Ali Barbara Boxer[8] California Senator
Frazier Dianne Feinstein[8] California Senator
Sabertooth Barney Frank[43] Massachusetts Congressman
Red Adam Putnam[44] Florida Congressman

Journalists[edit]

Nickname Personal name Notes
The Cobra Maureen Dowd[45] New York Times columnist
Stretch David Gregory[46][47][48] Television journalist formerly with NBC, currently with CNN
Little Stretch
Stretch Dick Kyle[48] Political correspondent with Bloomberg News
Super Stretch Bill Sammon[48] Former White House correspondent for The Washington Times and The Washington Examiner, current Fox News editing manager
Mikey Mike Emanuel[49] Fox News White House correspondent
Shades Peter Wallsten[50] Political reporter with the Wall Street Journal. Bush mocked him for wearing sunglasses inside, not knowing Wallsten is partially blind.
Panchito Frank Bruni[51] New York Times reporter who covered the Bush campaign in 2000

Others[edit]

Nickname Personal name Notes
Kenny Boy Kenneth Lay[52] Enron Corporation CEO
Weadie Doug Wead[53] Author
Weadnik
The Englishman Peter McMahon[54] Dana Perino's husband
Flies on the Eyeballs Guy Cofer Black[55] Director of the CIA Counterterrorist Center
Rosey Jack Rosen[56] Chief Executive of Rosen Partners LLC.

  • List of nicknames of Presidents of the United States
